title: Circular Walk Around Bourton on the Water Route

images.title: Graham Taylor / Bourton on the Water
images.caption: The mill and old stone footbridge over the River Windrush.

images.title: Keith Fairhurst / Bourton on the Water
images.caption: Taken on one of the four footbridges across the river.

images.title: Trevor Rickard / River Windrush at Bourton-on-the-Water
images.caption: Looking south-east to the most downstream of the bridges in the village.

images.title: Christine Matthews / Lake at Bourton on the Water, Gloucestershire
images.caption: Lake at Bourton on the Water. Bench and lake at Bourton on the Water near Cotswold Carp Farm

images.title: Trevor Rickard / Converted Mill House at Bourton-on-the-Water
images.caption: Converted Mill House. This private house has the garden on an island to the left with the main dwelling on the right. Looks like the river Windrush flows underneath the lounge!

images.title: Colin Smith / The Motor Museum, Bourton-on-the-Water.
images.caption: The Motor Museum. This popular Gloucestershire village on the shallow River Windrush attracts hordes of day trippers from the West Midlands conurbation on a fine day. The museum itself is built in typical Cotswold stone.

images.title: Alan Sillitoe / Restaurant alongside the river, Bourton on the Water
images.caption: Restaurant alongside the river, Bourton on the Water

description: Enjoy a walk through this lovely village known as the 'Venice of the Cotswolds'. The High Street is particularly picturesque with the River Windrush running through it with several pretty little stone bridges crossing. This walk makes use of the North Cotswold Diamond Way and the Oxfordshire Way to take you through the countryside to the nearby fishing lakes. You could also extend your walk by following the Windrush Way west along the river. The walk also passes Birdland which has a variety of exotic birds and a collection of penguins. There is a large pond full of salmon which can be fed by the public. The 1930s Model village and Model Railway Exhibition are also well worth seeing. To extend your walking from the village try our Circular Walk from Bourton through Naunton and The Slaughters . It will take you to the village of Naunton along the river before heading to The Slaughters where there's lovely paths along the River Eye to enjoy.
